Patten St is resident-only parking during the day, which is fine. The trouble is that for our specific area, we need some resident-only restriction at night as well, and perhaps some No Standing signs. One neighbor runs a business out of his house (whether licensed or not I do not know), and it regularly causes traffic tie-ups and a dearth of spaces as parents sit there for hours waiting for their kids to be done. 

It's even worse in the winter, since he has a driveway and NEVER shovels the streets spaces in front of his house, so his clients constantly park and sit in their cars in the spaces we had to shovel out (leaving us no place to park). This neighbor clearly does not care about this impact on the rest of the neighborhood; it's been brought to his attention repeatedly and nothing has changed.

Is there any sort of remedy for this? This influx several times a week of non-resident cars just idling in front of our house has gotten worse, and we're really tired of it.

Thank you

The lobby of the prudential center across from back bay station has ongoing fire code violations.  There are three doors.  One is broken and one is locked.  They lock one door on cold days.  This leaves only one working exit.  I have spoken with security here and they have no response.  I have called the BFD and got transferred around with nobody willing to take a report. I was transferred 4 times and disconnected.  I am very unhappy about that as the FD should be eager to hear about code violations that could result in significant loss of life (station night club, coconut grove etc).  Insulting also that the door they choose to lock is the door with handicap assist.  Happens on every cold day.  Please have the BFD cite them and let them know this practice is not tolerated.  Thank you.
address: Intersection Of Dartmouth St & Massachusetts Tpke E, Boston
